description: Construction of part single storey, part two storey building (for use as a community church hall, meeting room/ office, kitchen, toilets and priest/ caretaker flat); an enclosed walkway linking new building to church; and new toilet block to the western end of the church, (following the demolition of the existing toilet block).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: GS8110341/100 (Site Survey), GS8110341/101A (Existing Elevations & Floor Plans), 1A (Proposed Ground Floor Layout & Site Plan), 2A  (Proposed First Floor Layout & Site Plan), 3A  (Proposed Roof Layout & Site Plan), 4A (Proposed Elevations), 5A (Proposed Elevations), 6A (Proposed Building Sections),  8B (Boundary Treatment), 11028100 (Arboricultural Survey Plan), 11028110 (Tree Constraints/Tree Protection Plan), Planning Design and Access Statement (Jeffrey Charles Emmett February 2015), Arboricultural Method Statement for Construction Works Close to Trees dated 14th February 2014  (Issued by Jenks Oxford on behalf of Jeffrey Charles Emmett), Schedule of Boundary Treatment (issued April 2012), Pre-start conditions - P/2011/4803 (Jeffrey Charles Emmett), Amended Transport Statement issued on behalf of Ryaeca relating to Green Man Passgae, Ealing W13 0TG - March 2014 (Jeffrey Charles Emmett), Hepworth Acoustics (Report 31138 1v2) August 2011, A schedule of 'Hard Landscape Specifications', Planting Schedule' and drawing SN/23/1.11, Schedule of External Facing Materials dated April 2012; External Walls - Ibstock Reigate Purple Multi-facing bricks; Segmental arches over windows - painted white to match Church; Main roofs - Muguenot Val de Seine plain clay tiles; Roofs of replacement WC and foyer link - natural grey slate; All windows - double glazed white upvc made by Radley Windows; Double glazed link - white upvc made by Radley Windows; Front/rear to foyer - painted softwood, and Fire escape/bin store doors - painted softwood, received 25/02/2015 and email received from Sue Blewitt of Jeffrey Charles Emmett Planning Consultancy dated 08/05/2015.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | No development shall commence until a site construction method statement and management plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with the Local Highways Authority.  The site construction method statement/management plan shall include the following:  - Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site -Delivery times and frequency -Construction route  -Proposed on-site construction worker/delivery parking - any waiting or loading on the public highway -Dust suppression measures -Wheel washing provisions -Site security during construction -On site storage -Tree protection measures -A survey of the condition of the construction access surface on Green Man Passage - Construction vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. - Procedure for on site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents - Details of temporary vehicles access - Signing for construction traffic - Emergency contact details - Construction work programme setting out key milestones - Adequate facilities for pedestrians and cyclists during the construction works including traffic management for any diversions.  - Proposals for freight consolidation and re-timing of deliveries     - Details of a written or legal agreement with Ealing Highways department regarding temporary vehicle access, highway safety measures and arrangements to make good any damage caused to the footway during construction.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the construction works.  Reason:  To ensure adequate safety for pedestrians and cyclists, to prevent damage to the adjacent highway and to protect the amenity of local residents in accordance with 1.1 (f)(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2015), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | The development hereby approved shall not operate outside the hours of 0800 - 2100hrs Mondays to Friday and 0900 - 1700hrs Saturdays, and 1000 - 15:00 Sundays.   Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | The development hereby permitted shall be used only for purposes ancillary (Church Hall and Priest/Caretakers Flat) to the authorised use of the site as a Church (D1 Use Class), unless otherwise agreed in writing by Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality i n accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 ( Noise and Vibration), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2015). | The residential flat hereby approved shall be ancillary to the existing Church (D1 use) and shall be occupied only by the priest/caretaker and their family, and shall not form a separate self contained residential flat (C3 use) without express permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality i n accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 ( Noise and Vibration), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2015). | Amplified music/sound shall not be played at the site outside the hours of 10:00 - 20:00hrs, Monday to Friday and 10:00 - 1700hrs Saturdays, and 1000 - 15:00 Sundays.   Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality i n accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 ( Noise and Vibration), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2015). | Should the development propose to install underground services within the Root Protection Areas (RPA's) of retained trees a construction method statement which shall include on site monitoring by a suitably qualified arboricultural consultant shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the installation of those underground services. The development shall thereafter only be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To protect trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No external plant/machinery or additional openings, shall be installed the external surfaces of the building hereby permitted without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers of residential properties in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | Secure and lockable cycle parking facilities for 4 bicycles shall be installed at the site prior to the first use of the development and shall be retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015). | The trees to be retained as set out in the submitted Arboricultural Survey (Jenks Oct 2011), the Arboricultural Survey Plan (11028100) and the Tree Constraints/Tree Protection Plan (11028110) shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Within the Root Protection Area (RPA) of trees there should be no excavation of type 1 foundation /road stone or subsoil, except when undertaken by hand and only for essential services.  Reason: To protect trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
